Reviews.Content: Great relaxing break This is now the third time we have stayed at this hotel over the past 10 years (including getting married in the grounds in 2001).The hotel is one of the larger resort types in the area and is absolute beachfront. There are many rooms, howeve they all surround a lovely lush, garden setting.The pool is nice - nothing mind-blowing, but pleasant with a waterfall and a hot  cold spa.The rooms are comfortable and clean. The bathrooms are small but functional and there is complimentary water provided each day. There is a plenty of channels on the T.V.Breakfast was included in our stay and I must say that there was choice galore! Every cuisine was catered for - noodles for Asian travellers, meats and cheeses for Europeans and big jar of Vegemite for us Australians.You can easily reach the Discovery Mall shopping Plaza via a 5-10 minute walk along the beach or you can go out the front and experience the traffic on the street. A walk into Kuta intself is about 20 minutes.The staff are genuinely friendly - i.e it's not forced. Their smiles are natural.The prices at the resturant, bar and spa are excessive by Bali standards and we only ate once at the restuarant as it was included in our room stay. The food was pretty ordinary compared with breakfast fare. There are so many restuarants within a stone's throw that I wouldn't bother eating at the hotel.All in all - great stay. The pool wasn't crowded and plently of sun-lounges to go about. The hotel has many amenities, but we didn't utilise much apart from the pool. The hotel is quiet considering the amount of rooms and it is clean, relaxing and pretty good value.
Reviews.Author: Leighbee27

Reviews.Content: A Good Choice       Hotel Gardens
Reviews.Author: Merry_8

Reviews.Content: Loved the Ramada Bintang! We would highly recommend the Ramada Bintang to all our family and friends. We found the rooms to be very clean every day, and we stayed 10 days! The food from all resturants including breakfasts were exceptional. The surrounding gardens and pool areas were always very clean with people working on them daily. We are headed back there in August for 12 days and only hope our stay was as enjoyable as the first trip there.
Reviews.Author: Taisha

Reviews.Content: Worst Experience I travel with my family, and we booked 2 rooms with connecting door. This is the worst holiday experience, do not stay there and advice your friend, family or relatives don't experience my mistake.1. Overall hotel out of date, need renovation. The room smells cigarrette and dirty, not well cleaned and maintain. Air cond not working well. Bathroom smells, dirty and they only supplied a soap.2. Beach quite dirty and the sea quite rough, polution.3. Breakfast is good, and they served various food. The quality is average. Room service is overprice4. Staff service not good, they don't care and they don't put attention.5. Location is perfect.
Reviews.Author: leonardth

Reviews.Content: Beautiful Family Hotel We visited the ramada Bintang in January this year. I visited with my husband  2 kids aged 129. Our stay was very comfortable room was very neat with good furniture, beautiful pool area very beautiful surroundings. Close to all shopping centres. The only dissapointment was the breakfast although very big varietie quite tasteless. The staff were very friendly  helpful. Would i stay there if i went back to Bali?. Definetely. Compared to other hotels in this area the Ramada was the best in my view.
Reviews.Author: br0wneyes

Reviews.Content: Better value elsewhere My partner and I stayed at the Ramada for 1 night in Feb 08, not out of choice, as there were no availability for that night in our preferred hotels due to an Environment conference then. From our quick observation; Ramada is a large resort with about 400 rooms spread over 4 stories. Our room on the 3rd floor, is quite spacious and has a small balcony overlooking the gardens and the pool beyond. The verandah and the room itself, is a bit dated and could do with a new coat of paint. The room was reasonably furnished. Our king-size bed was quite firm and extremely comfortable 鈥?just what we needed for a good night sleep. The Ramada is sited in an expansive garden which is very neatly kept. The swimming pool is quite large and well located, facing the beach. The beach itself was quite dirty and the sea quite rough then, probably due to the monsoon season. Regardless, my partner and I had a lovely time sitting at the bar and enjoying our long chat, with the sea breezes blowing in our face. Location-wise, the Ramada is quite ideal, just a 10-15 mins walk to Kuta Square and Centro-Kartika shopping centre. The quality in the Restaurant was below par as the curry fish that we had for dinner was so tough and dry. The breakfast buffet was quite extensive but the quality was also quite poor and we were disappointed that there weren鈥檛 more Balinese fare. Overall, I think the Ramada is over-priced and you could find smaller hotels further away from town with better value for money. (We paid half as much in AlamKulKul for the rest of our stay in Kuta.)
Reviews.Author: Member88

Reviews.Content: Great Stayed at this hotel for a week after leaving Nusa Dua got a romantic room for $100 per night pool area was great room nice enough and the food in the Wharf on the speciality nights was good. Easy walking distance to Kuta Sq. Has its own small private beach full of hawkers. Overall great value
Reviews.Author: hippychick1965

Reviews.Content: Nightmare on Elm Street NEVER STAY IN THIS HOTEL. Better sleep under some banana leaves on the beach. Even if this is last possible option for you in Bali, DO NOT go thre, better stay at home. Avoid it at any cost ans advice all your friend and relatives not to repeat my mistake.I was so unlucky to find myself in its premicies - I feel terrible still after beeing back.1/ Awfully outdated. Worst possible rooms on this planet- fungus and mildew in the bathroom, of all bathroom anemities I found only a piece of soap. Furniture chipped, armchairs stains, non-smoking room SMELLs like tobacco factory. On the walls you can clearly see gekko poo straces. None cared to remove them on regular basis (I complain not about gekkos` presense but cleaning team lack of attention).2/ Breakfast is a complete disaster. If this so callled hotel management thinks that nasi goreng (only) is OK as morning meal for the guests around the world - I strongly advice them to think twice.3/ Seaside, beach - beyond comments, only profanity. Litter everywhere, polution, used plastic bags, cups, bottles etc.4/ There are lots and lots beautiful places in Bali (hotels as well), please choose them, and DO NOT repeat my mistake.
Reviews.Author: Schonefeld

Reviews.Content: Great value for money 2 of us stayed at the Ramada for the 1st 12 days of December.The Ramada is located within 10 minutes walk to Discovery Mall and within 15 minutes of Kuta Centre. The hotel is great value for money. The staff made us feel welcome from the start. The rooms are OK and good value for money. A solid 4 star but not a 5 star hotel. The gym and the tennis need renovating as they are old. The pool is large and set in a nice park. The spa and restaurants are good. Breakfast has a nice selection. We had a non-smoking room on the top floor (3rd floor) with a small balcony. Through the trees we could see the pool. Beach is undergoing extension work (wooden side-walk is been built), so not ideal at the moment. Would definitely go back as overall the experience was very positive.
Reviews.Author: Oliviauk

Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel       Swimming Pool
Reviews.Author: Ceciz

Reviews.Content: Love The Hotel Nice hotel connected to the Beach. Nice room, reasonable price, and good service.
Reviews.Author: yuliechristina

Reviews.Content: The best hotel in Bali We have just returned from 5 nights at the Ramada Bintang. It was a return visit which is very rare for us as we like to try different areas and hotels in Bali but we loved Ramada so much we had to return. I had asked for a particular room and when we arrived we were given the exact room we had asked for, which for Bali hotels is amazing. Ramada is a very big hotel but you are not aware of the size due to the lay out. We always walk through the garden to get to our room so it never feels like a four storey building. I have stayed at the smaller boutique hotels but I am not that keen on the smallness of them and having to be everyones best friend. The facilites at this hotel are very good, the beachfront spa is one of the best in Bali (but expensive ), the pool is on the beach front, the decor in the rooms is excellent and the wharf on the beach as perfect place to see the sunset. The staff are wonderful and nothing is to much trouble. The prices within the hotel ( except the spa ) are very reasonable. We book our driver direct at the hotel and it is not expensive. I like the Tuban area as it is 5 minutes from the airport, plenty of spas around it, good restaurants,( try Ma Jolly next door to left along beach, divine.) You can walk to Discovery or Matahai ( or $1 taxi ) or you can stroll along the beach to main Kuta beach or you can just chill by the pool with cocktail.Ramada has faults but tell me a hotel that doesnt. You can hear footsteps from room above but if that bothers you book into the 4th floor which are all non smoking rooms. The bathrooms are not huge but there is a very big bath. They do have coffee and tea making facilites and a bar fridge with ice. The spa prices need to be reviewed.Buffet breakfast is huge but we just had a freshly made omlette everyday with juice, coffee and crossiant
Reviews.Author: tigerbeer

Reviews.Content: Superb Resort We spent 10 nights at the Ramada Bintang and found the resort fantastic. Requested a ground floor room facing the central garden and our room was closest to the pool area but still lots of privacy. Staff were great and could not do enough for us. Plenty of activities provided for guests, breakfasts were fabulous.The location of the resort was also good, lots of great restaurants within walking distance and only a 10 minute walk into Kuta.Room was very clean and we will definitely be staying there again.
Reviews.Author: gracep07

Reviews.Content: Pure delight! I stayed at the Ramada Bintang Bali Resort for my 21st birthday along with my family. We had the best time. The staff were genuinely friendly and very helpful. The food was beautiful! The rooms were big and very clean. The facilities were fantastic. Anything i needed or wanted was provided.The staff even threw me a birthday party with a cake! Free of charge! I am now planning a holiday with my 1 year old daughter for 2008 and will be returning to the Ramada.
Reviews.Author: menyou

Reviews.Content: Don't go there We stayed at the Ramada Bintang for one week as part of a pre-booked Bali-trip. What a terrible place to stay if you're looking for quality time or a nice, quiet and relaxing holliday. The hotel is completely outdated and desparately needs complete renovation to bring up to a modern standards. The rooms are very small and very noisy, due to poor maintenance lots is out of orde. Due to the fact that the Ramada Bintang is a sort of state hotel the mix of guests isbad if you go there for a holliday. Lots of noisy government and business guests and students who all behave like 'Alice in Wonderland' Reception staff is not very helpfull and don't give you the feeling you're a welcom guest/customer. Tip: avoid the pre-set buffets, no value for money. The breakfast-buffet can also be a disater if you come at the wrong time. Tables are a mess if you can find a clean one and half of the buffet is empty. It's supposed to be a 4/5 star Hotel/Resort, I would rate it not more than 2,5 star. There are better places to stay in Kuta.
Reviews.Author: Boxter09

Reviews.Content: A true delight I stayed at the Ramada Bintang Bali Resort for 6 days in October 2006. While only there for a short period, I was hugely impressed by the standard of the hotel. Firstly, the staff were absolutely amazing, especially a young lady at the Reception desk. Not only did she remember the names of my friend and I, book our tours, but she was just so friendly. All the staff were prepared to go that extra mile to accommodate our needs.I shared a superior twin room with a friend, and the room was always clean. Certainly, the room had general wear and tear ie: scuffs on the floor, but that can only be expected. The resort itself was immaculate, and the gardens well kept. Perhaps one of the features I loved the most was the heated and cooled pools that sat above the enormous swimming pool and waterfall. The resort itself is about 15-20mins walk to Central Kuta, and about 10 to the Discovery Plaza. You can either walk along the street or the beach. It is a beachfront Resort, however the surf wasn't particularly good, but it is a short walk to better waves.For the most part, the food at the Resort was quite good. However, after a hard day shopping my friend and I ordered roomservice only to severely disappointed with the supermarket-frozen-food-isle standard of food that arrived. We also had problems trying to place an international call out of the Hotel using a phone card - I don't believe the operators understood. We had a problem with the airconditioner, but I am certain that if we had phoned reception, it would have been repaired immediatly.The Ramada Bintang Bali is a huge, but very quiet resort. By 7pm, not a soul was to be seen in the grounds. This is a disadvantage to those my age looking for a lively time - but it would be very good for families and couples.Overall - It is a fantastic resort, and I highly recommend it (even just for the cooled and heated pools!).for more photos email bastet_girl@hotmail.com
Reviews.Author: Selina_Kyle

Reviews.Content: A pretty good hotel, but not 4 star We stayed 2 weeks in June this year  found the hotel to be quite nice. Other than the fairly neutral front desk staff, we found the wonderful staff to be the highlight of the hotel. The room staff, pool staff and restaurant staff were a delight.The rooms are a little tired, they would once have been very nice but are in need of renovation. They are a good size, have bar fridges, and extensive TV channels.The breakfast is entensive, hot and of good quality, and is also varied a little which is nice during a longish stay.The grounds are very nice, and the pool is great. There are plenty of pool chairs and there's a waterfall in the pool, which the kids loved. There's also a hot spa which is upstairs from the pool.The location of the hotel is very good, it's close to everything without being noisy or chaotic. It's close to Waterbom, Discovery and many nice shops and restaurants.
Reviews.Author: Dromomaniac

Reviews.Content: Excellent service!! We stayed at the Ramada Bintang for 4D3N free and easy tour. As it was our first visit to Bali, our knowledge of the island paradise was quite limited. The Guest Relations Officers were a great help! They offered advice from guided tours to spas. Very quickly we found ourselves on a guided tour of some of the best Bali has to offer. The breakfast provided by the hotel was simply delicious, with a great offering that included some local treats. The hotel room was clean and provided all the amenities you would expect of a 5 star hotel. The famous Kuta beach was just a short 10mins+ walk. The strategic location combined with excellent service made our trip a pleasant and memorable experience.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Our favourite hotel The Ramada is a large friendly resort located on the beach with direct beach access.We have stayed there for many years and find it meets all our needs.Though a large resort there is enough room for privacy if that is what you require.The friendly staff are a definite attraction and they ensure you do as little or as much as you want.The pool is large and can at times be crowded.There are a number of quality eateries in the complex catering for all tastes.Tuban is a quiet area and only a short walk along the beach to busy Kuta.
Reviews.Author: fidgi53

Reviews.Content: Second visit We have stayed at this hotel twice and enjoyed our visit both times. We have found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. On our last visit when returning home I discovered I had left my keys in the room safe and after a phone call to the hotel, they were returned to me within a couple of days. I call that very good service.The people selling things on the beach and in the streets are a part of Bali and if you treat them with respect remembering it is the way that they earn thier living then they leave you alone and you can even have a laugh and a joke with them.This hotel is within a comftable walk to all the shops in Kuta and Waterbom and the new Discovery Plaza are even closer. You also have the choice of walking along the road or down the beach to get to Kuta.We are planning to return to Bali later this year for our 4th visit at at present will be returning to the Ramada Bintang.
Reviews.Author: Jane_melb

Reviews.Content: Dreadful hotel This was our 4th holiday to Bali and the Ramada Bintang was the worst hotel by far. We took our 12 month old who was still crawling. Our room was one of the closest to the pool and therefore probably the most requested and used. The floors were filthy (her knees and hands were always black) and no matter how many times we asked (v nicely I might add) we could not get it washed. A nice staff member eventually told us the hotel did not give the cleaners buckets. They ended up cleaning it with a dry cloth but it was still dirty ... we gave up.The toilets blocked every 2 days and when the guys arrived to unblock the toilet they used a mop and then dripped toilet water back out the room. I was truly concerned our daughter would end up with a disease. The bar fridge smelt terrible and we found it was very dirty inside  underneath.The grounds were lovely and breakfast quite nice. The staff were very polite and friendly.Overall I would avoid this hotel at all costs unless management clean up. I was glad when our holiday ended and we could go home. We couldnt be bothered complaining as we were sick of the managers poor response.
Reviews.Author: DeeElle

Reviews.Content: Ramada Bintang - great family resort We have just returned from staying at the Ramada Bintang Hotel in Tuban.We thoroughly recommend this hotel to families. Our children are 11 and 9 years of age and we all felt welcome.There are a mixture of couples and families staying at this resort. It is a very large ( approx 400 rooms) resort. Our Rooms were near the front of the hotel which meant we had a 5 minuite walk to the pool which was not too big a hassel. We just got a bit more organised.We had 2 interconnecting rooms which were clean and comfortable. Our rooms looked over the lovely gardens.Breakfast was huge. So many choices and a very good standard. We often did not require lunch.The reort is well positioned on Kartika street. Plenty of little shops and a short stroll to the Discovery Mall and Waterbom Park. We did often use the taxi to go up to Legian or Kuta as the Kids found it too far to walk.The reort is right on the beach which is great for surfing or walking up to Kuta. You can geat massages and hair braiding done on the beach there bit I found the people were a bit too pushy compared to Tanjung Benoa and other spots.I would recoomend this hotel to families. A great position and good facilities.
Reviews.Author: surfnsally

Reviews.Content: It's okay I must start by saying I wouldn鈥檛 go back to this hotel, but the main problem was the lack of information, or better yet, wrong one, from our travel agent back home.Tuban is Kuta anyway you see it, there is the traffic, the commotion, the life, the polluted air鈥?but a considerable walking distance to poppies Lane 1, Legion Street鈥?well, the places to go and eat cheap, shop, and see all the commotion.The other thing the travel agent forgot to mention was the lousy beach in Tuban. Even though in Kuta the hotels aren鈥檛 on the beach (there is always a street passing in front) and there are a lot of people in the beach, I think for young people that is much more Bali!Mainly, what I mean is in Kuta area location is key, so I would recommend a hotel like Mercure.Now, about the hotel it self, except the fact the employees reserve chairs in the swimming pool with towels so you have no choice but to go and talk to them and in exchange of a few rupees find out that they are actually not occupied, everything was suited to the rating of the hotel 鈥?a 4 star.The rooms are very nice and spacious, the staff very nice, breakfast good in spite things had a tendency of being out for a long period of time, the gardens were neat and you can hear the birds in the trees.
Reviews.Author: Gomes

Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay Stayed there in 2002 and had a good time. It is only 5 minutes from the airport, you can get a free transfer if you ask in advance. But it is not an airoirt hotel, i mean you lie on the beach and can see the planes come down but it does not disturb. My room was nice, no complaints. Tip the maids and they bring you fruits and flowers. Food is good, reasonable prizes in pool bar and restaurants, some live entertainment in the bars, enjoyed it. Staff is really nice. The pool is phantastic, the biggest I have seen in Bali. The beach is not all sand but some stones so bring slippers or take a cab to another beach. Many restaurants on the street, try the Thai place Kin Khao and Kuta Seafood. Downtown Kuta is a 15 minutes stroll but take a cab because everyone on the street will try to sell you something or offer you a car. If you are on your own, you should really take such an offer. Get a nice Jeep with aircon and a driver, who will show you the island all day for 150000 Rupias. Better and not more expensive than a guided tour. I would stay there again! I think room was about 50 USD, booked through travel agency.
Reviews.Author: Countrybob

Reviews.Content: one of the best hotels I've stayed in this lovely hotel is well worth a visit its set in beutiful gardens with lovely rooms and a great pool,the food was superb and the service wonderful
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: 鈽呫儛銉害婧€鐐光槄   showReview(22855532, 'full');
